intro: Diodia polymorpha var. microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved diodia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Americas. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb with slender, branching stems and small, ovate leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, producing a faintly fragrant odor. It is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
